posts.post_content: Selesnya theme has changed a little, it used to value smaller tokens but mass in number, populate on the other hand favors bigger tokens. There are more cards making small tokens than big ones at this point, so I find Trostani work best with the original theme than the new one (with logical supporting cards, of course).
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Playing [Wolfir Silverheart](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wolfir Silverheart)? 8 life.  
Playing [Armada Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armada Wurm)? 10 life.  
Blinking [Thragtusk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thragtusk) with [Restoration Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Restoration Angel)? 15 life.  
Seeing your opponent struggle to get you bellow 30 life? Priceless.  
  
There are some games lifegain can't win. For everything else, there's Trostani.

posts.post_content:
You know how there's always a "Magic Number?" [Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir) had the magic number 4 toughness because of burn. The Titans, [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine), and [Consecrated Sphinx](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Consecrated Sphinx) had the magic number 6 toughness because of [Dismember](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dismember). Well, to my knowledge, this is one of the few cards in Innistrad-Return to Ravvnica that hits the magic number *4 times*:  
  
>1 Color ([Ultimate Price](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ultimate Price))  
>3 CMC ([Abrupt Decay](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Abrupt Decay))  
>4 Toughness ([Mizzium Mortars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mizzium Mortars))  
<5 Power ([Selesnya Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selesnya Charm))  
  
Just thought that was kind of cool.  
  
Incidentally, [Rakdos, Lord of Riots](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rakdos, Lord of Riots) and [Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius) die to [Selesnya Charm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Selesnya Charm). [Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord) can't be safe from both that and [Mizzium Mortars](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mizzium Mortars). Poor [Isperia, Supreme Judge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isperia, Supreme Judge) dies to both ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
You know how there's always a "Magic Number?" Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir had the magic number 4 toughness because of burn. The Titans, Wurmcoil Engine, and Consecrated Sphinx had the magic number 6 toughness because of Dismember. Well, to my knowledge, this is one of the few cards in Innistrad-Return to Ravvnica that hits the magic number 4 times:

>1 Color (Ultimate Price)
>3 CMC (Abrupt Decay)
>4 Toughness (Mizzium Mortars)
<5 Power (Selesnya Charm)

Just thought that was kind of cool.

Incidentally, Rakdos, Lord of Riots and Niv-Mizzet, Dracogenius die to Selesnya Charm. Jarad, Golgari Lich Lord can't be safe from both that and Mizzium Mortars. Poor Isperia, Supreme Judge dies to both ... (see all)

posts.post_content: I had this on the battlefield during a game yesterday - she was keeping me alive by populating 8/8 Elemental tokens from my Grove of the Guardian against a nasty Vampire deck. At one point, though, I was down to 8 life. And lo and behold, I Miracled Entreat The Angels...6 Angel tokens and 24 life later, I had gone from the brink (literally one life) to 50 life in about 3 turns. Needless to say, I won that game.

posts.post_content:
I am surprised this card is rated that low. Solid body for 4 but that is the least of it. Life gaining ability will save you blockers and, in extension, creatures, while the populate on demend ability will boost yourcreature numbers to overwhelm your opponents.   
In limited every time it hits the battlefield it's a two round concede by the opponent.  
Very useful in other formats too.  
  
Disadvantages? she needs a deck revolving around her. but hey... she is the leader of a whole guild, what did you expect?!

posts.post_content:
So many great combos in commander.  
[Phyrexian Processor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Processor) Pay life for tokens, then get that life back. Every turn.  
[Storm Herd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Storm Herd) Get tokens, double your life total.  
[Ajani Goldmane](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ajani Goldmane) See above.  
[Mimic Vat](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mimic Vat) Returns your dead creatures as tokens for cheap. Populate them and it's like they were never gone.  
[Séance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Séance) See above.  
[Soul Foundry](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Soul Foundry) Same as above but without waiting for your favourite creature to die.  
[Orochi Hatchery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Orochi Hatchery) Sure, why not?  
[Nacatl War-Pride](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Nacatl War-Pride) Make tokens of tokens that make more tokens!  
That's all staying within her colors. Most of the cards are dirt cheap too.  
To keep the mana flowing use [Citanul Hierophants](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Citanul Hierophants).  
Don't forget untappers, buffs and multiple sources of populate! And for the love of god protect your commander!
posts.html:

Ajani Goldmane See above.
Mimic Vat Returns your dead creatures as tokens for cheap. Populate them and it's like they were never gone.

Orochi Hatchery Sure, why not?
Nacatl War-Pride Make tokens of tokens that make more tokens!
That's all staying within her colors. Most of the cards are dirt cheap too.
